docs.snippet: AT&T is bringing out a 60-second version of its most recent 30-second spot about a charitable shoe company.
docs.lead_paragraph: At a time when most TV viewers would like to see 30-second commercials become three-second commercials - or maybe even zero-second commercials - a big advertiser is bringing out a 60-second version of its most recent 30-second spot.
docs.abstract: AT&T is bringing out a 60-second version of its most recent 30-second spot about a charitable shoe company.

headline.main: You Make the Call as AT&T Supersizes a Spot About Shoes

docs.snippet: 9 P.M. (SNY) BEER MONEY SportsNet New York, the television home of the Mets, continues to offer sports fans a modest stimulus package with a new season of trivia-for-cash games. Chris Carlin and Alexi Panos (above left, with a contestant) wander the...
docs.lead_paragraph: 9 P.M. (SNY) BEER MONEY SportsNet New York, the television home of the Mets, continues to offer sports fans a modest stimulus package with a new season of trivia-for-cash games. Chris Carlin and Alexi Panos (above left, with a contestant) wander the city, with stops at stadiums, arenas, tailgate parties and even Central Park, to pepper those versed in all things athletic with questions. Correct answers equal money -- and if you're lucky, enough cash to pay for those pricey home-plate tickets at CitiField. 7 A.M. (CBS) THE EARLY SHOW Simon Baker talks about the season finale of his series ''The Mentalist.'' Also, a 10-year-old girl battles breast cancer.
